comments:
I'm running HEAD of all of the provisioning code.  I generated fresh metadata for 3.3 and then ran a launch config I had already set up -- for self-hosting, so lots of arguments to file locations, etc. were already set and still valid.

I then switched to the Provisioning perspective, created a new profile and dragged the sdk to the new profile.  I then got an error:


Requirement not satisfied: requiredCapability: org.eclipse.equinox.prov.iunamespace/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.motif.linux.x86/0.0.0

with the following in the host workbench's console:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.equinox.prov.ui 4 0 2007-08-14 13:49:47.310
!MESSAGE 
!STACK 0
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Requirement not satisfied: requiredCapability: org.eclipse.equinox.prov.iunamespace/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.motif.linux.x86/0.0.0
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewDependencyExpander.collectMatches(NewDependencyExpander.java:174)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewDependencyExpander.algo(NewDependencyExpander.java:305)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewDependencyExpander.expand(NewDependencyExpander.java:107)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewSimpleDirector.install(NewSimpleDirector.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.ui.internal.ProvisioningUtil.install(ProvisioningUtil.java:309)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.ui.operations.InstallOperation.doExecute(InstallOperation.java:34)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.ui.operations.ProvisioningOperation.execute(ProvisioningOperation.java:45)
	at org.eclipse.core.commands.operations.DefaultOperationHistory.execute(DefaultOperationHistory.java:511)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.ui.viewers.InstallIUDropAdapter$1.run(InstallIUDropAdapter.java:259)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

I get a similar problem on my machine. I am running a build on Linux and generating all the metadata and then running the director and trying to get it to install a windows client. The error I get is a missing required capability on SWT. 

I just added code to the Director application to allow values for NL/OS/WS/ARCH to be passed on the command-line but that didn't seem to fix it.

Still investigating...

fyi, this is the stack trace that I am seeing.

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Requirement not satisfied: requiredCapability: fragment/org.eclipse.swt/0.0.0
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewDependencyExpander.collectMatches(NewDependencyExpander.java:174)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewDependencyExpander.algo(NewDependencyExpander.java:305)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewDependencyExpander.expand(NewDependencyExpander.java:107)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewSimpleDirector.install(NewSimpleDirector.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.internal.director.app.Application.start(Application.java:77)
	...
I have entered bug 199956 with details of my problems. Andrew, are you generating metadata from Windows or Linux? Are you mixing OSes like I am? If so, then our problem might be the same.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Andrew, are you
> generating metadata from Windows or Linux? Are you mixing OSes like I am?

I'm generating and attempting to the metadata on Linux.

Andrew even though you are running on linux for both, I think you are being burnt by the metadata generator thinking that you are running on a motif box (this is the default when running on linux) and thus generating metadata accordingly. Then when you install you are given gtk as a ws and there is probably no metadata for it.

(In reply to comment #5)
> Andrew even though you are running on linux for both, I think you are being
> burnt by the metadata generator thinking that you are running on a motif box
> (this is the default when running on linux) and thus generating metadata
> accordingly. Then when you install you are given gtk as a ws and there is
> probably no metadata for it.

So should I pass some argument to the metadata generator?

Starting the generator with -ws gtk may help.
DJ and I are looking into a real fix.
I believe this has been fixed with various changes in the generators and the agent.
